batchLockCollateral(bytes32[],address[],.details: Arrays must have equal length, called by MarketController for batch operations

params.amounts: Array of collateral amounts to lock
params.users: Array of addresses whose collateral to lock

batchUnlockCollateral(bytes32[],address[.details: Arrays must have equal length, called by MarketController for batch operations

params.amounts: Array of payout amounts determined by market resolution
params.users: Array of users redeeming position tokens

depositCollateral(uint256).details: Requires prior ERC20 approval for vault contract

params.amount: Number of collateral tokens to deposit

returns._0: Available balance for withdrawal or position creation
Total locked amount across all participants

lockCollateral(bytes32,address,uint256).details: Called by MarketController contract during position creation

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setPaused(bool).details: Only callable by contract owner, affects user-facing operations

transferBetweenUsers(bytes32,address,add.details: Called by MarketController during token swap settlements

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unlockCollateral(bytes32,address,uint256.details: Called by MarketController contract after successful claim verificationAllows unlocking to any user for proper market payout distribution

params.amount: Payout amount determined by market resolution

updateCollateralToken(address).details: Only callable by contract owner, for emergency situations

updateMarketController(address).details: Only callable by contract owner, for emergency situations

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdrawCollateral(uint256).details: Only withdraws from unlocked balance, reverts on insufficient funds

batchLockCollateral(bytes32[],address[],.notice: Locks collateral for multiple conditions in a single transaction

batchUnlockCollateral(bytes32[],address[.notice: Unlocks collateral from multiple resolved conditions in a single transaction

collateralToken().notice: The ERC20 token used as collateral for all positions

depositCollateral(uint256).notice: Deposits ERC20 collateral tokens into user's available balance

getTotalLocked(bytes32).notice: Returns total locked collateral for specific condition

lockCollateral(bytes32,address,uint256).notice: Locks user's available collateral for position token minting

marketController().notice: Address of the MarketController contract authorized to lock/unlock funds

paused().notice: Emergency pause state for contract operations

setPaused(bool).notice: Sets contract pause state for emergency situations

transferBetweenUsers(bytes32,address,add.notice: Transfers collateral between users' vault balances (for token swaps)

unlockCollateral(bytes32,address,uint256.notice: Unlocks collateral from resolved condition to user's available balance

withdrawCollateral(uint256).notice: Withdraws available collateral tokens to user's wallet
